Afghanistan: Battle of Gulnabad: Led by Mahmud, the Afghan army captured the Safavid capital of Isfahan and Mahmad was declared Shah of Persia.
Armenia: David Bek leads the national liberation movement in 1722, but passes away in 1728.
Belgium: Charles VI, Holy Roman Emperor grants a charter to the Ostend Company to trade with the Indies.
Brazil: Expedition lead by the second Anhanguera discovers gold in Goiás.
Chile: Rapa Nui (Easter Island) is discovered by Dutch navigator Jacob Roggeveen.
China:
The Kangxi Emperor died.
The Kangxi Emperor's son the Yongzheng Emperor became emperor of the Qing dynasty.
Philippine: Colegio de San Jose conferred with the title Royal.
Russia: Peter introduced the Table of Ranks, which granted the privileges of nobility based on state service. Russo-Persian War (1722–1723): A Russian military expedition sailed in support of the independence of two Christian kingdoms, Kartli and Armenia.
